intro: Alaticaulia telloi, commonly known as the Tello's alate caudex plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, thick, cylindrical caudex that stores water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming during the cooler months. It has a slow growth rate and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
